message.content:
cs.NE, cs.AR, cs.ET, cs.EM, cs.SY 

This paper discusses the development of low power neuromorphic hardware for signal processing applications. The focus is on spiking neural networks (SNNs) which are a type of neural network that mimics the time-based information encoding and processing aspects of the brain. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Additionally, the paper discusses the need for novel computational architectures to address the von Neumann bottleneck, which suggests the possibility of the paper belonging to cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) or cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also discusses the use of SNNs for signal processing applications, which could place it in cs.ET (Embedded Systems) or cs.EM (Emerging Technologies).
